snippet: G.M. said it had net income of $900 million in the fourth quarter, compared with $500 million in the same period a year earlier.
abstract: Continued losses in Europe offset strong sales by General Motors in North America; GM reports fourth-quarter profit of $900 million, compared with $500 million in year-ago quarter; revenue rose to $39.3 billion from $38 billion.
lead_paragraph: G.M. said it had net income of $900 million in the fourth quarter, compared with $500 million in the same period a year earlier.

headline.main: G.M.’s Profit Rises Despite Weakness in Europe
headline.print_headline: G.M.’s Profit Rises Despite Weakness in Europe
